p: In addition to the hydroxycinamic acids, we investigated the amount of QU and kaemferol (KE) flavonoids, polyphenolic compounds found in many fruits and vegetables [ 59]. QU has a bitter flavor and is used as an ingredient in dietary supplements, beverages, and foods. As expected, the medicinal plants of the Lamiaceae family (sage and thyme) as well as clove are characterized by a high content of flavonoids [ 60]; however, we obtained the highest values of QU and KE in stevia (4.87 ± 0.09 mg/g QU and 4.36 ± 0.085 KE).
